Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Pushed some non critical updates... Simplified miner code some more, I think its now just about as efficiant it can be... Found an unused function of james's that checks if a tx is to the crypto address using memcompare ... probably 100x faster than the old method I was using.  Also cleaned up some code and removed some things not needed elsewhere.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also it appears the code in dissconecct tip to clear orphaned txs has not stopped the wallet getting corrupted. I' lost as to what to do about this problem. I guess as a work around we will just need staking scripts to manage utxo's. Alright is working on those right now... Maybe just limiting it so it doent end up with 70,000 utxos will be enough to stop it corrupting. Disableing the rescan on start when its detected there are corrupt txs, doesn't seem a brilliant plan either, as it can try to mine blocks with corrupt txs or something. Not really sure exactly, but CFEK for me gets stuck in loops where it mines invalid blocks for hours.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: @Alright  added segid to getsnapshot

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its not a great solution, but at least you can grab an estimate of how much is being staked from each one now... output is far from easy to use, but I'm not really understanding the getsnapshot code so well.. I think I could copy paste the whole RPC and make a new one that returns just amounts per segid, but you have no idea what is actually being staked, so I dont think its  useful enough for me to spend my time on it. Unless someone wants this specifically.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I am going to continue to use my method from POSTEST and count actual stakes per segid from found blocks.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
pushed new RPC to master, that returns total stakes for each segid for defined muber of blocks. 
It counts back from the chaintip the number of blocks you speicfy, checks if the block was PoS, and extracts the segid of that address that staked it. 
This is a much neater and faster way of my staking strategy. Waiting on Alrights python staking scripts, to use as an example to intergrate this in. 
try running it on LAMEDUCKS 🤣 
`komodo-cli -ac_name=CFEKLAMEDUCKS getlastsegidstakes`
segid 5 and 7 have 3000-3500 stakes each, the rest ~200... I guess someone is staking to -pubkey on segid 5 and 7.
